thread.title: Noble House Hotels & Resorts adds two San Francisco properties
thread.title_full: Noble House Hotels & Resorts adds two San Francisco properties

author: eTN Editor
title: Noble House Hotels & Resorts adds two San Francisco properties
text:
Noble House Hotels & Resorts adds two San Francisco properties Adv: 
Jul 31, 2015 Adv: 
SEATTLE, WA - Noble House Hotels & Resorts, Ltd. – a collection of luxury hotels and resorts – has assumed management of the Argonaut Fisherman's Wharf Hotel and The Tuscan Fisherman's Wharf, a Best Western Plus Hotel, in San Francisco, owned by Pebblebrook Hotel Trust (NYSE: PEB). The hotels bring the Noble House Hotels & Resorts (NHHR) hospitality portfolio to 18 properties. 
"We're happy to welcome these two distinctive properties into the Noble House collection," said Pat Colee, Noble House Founder and Chairman of the Board. "With these hotels, we are continuing our focus on building our brand portfolio and growing in attractive regions within the U.S. We look forward to our ongoing relationship with Pebblebrook Hotel Trust." 
Noble House is committed to employee growth and retention, and values the current teams' dedication to the Argonaut and The Tuscan hotels. Both hotels will retain all employees, maintaining the strength of the personnel that run the properties seamlessly on a daily basis. 
The 252-room Argonaut Fisherman's Wharf Hotel is located along the popular Fisherman's Wharf, situated in the San Francisco Maritime National Park and is home to the park's Visitors Center and Interactive Museum. The Tuscan Fisherman's Wharf features 221 guestrooms and is in close proximity to Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39, cable cars, bay cruises and the clubs and cafes of North Beach.
